reviews.review: Play it and cry, Then Sell your tears for money. Thats how you make stonks
ive had the game for 4 days and played 21 hours

this game is best played with your friends on voice chat. randoms typically will help you with tasks and unhook you but sometimes you get that one person that just ignores you on the hook. communication is really limited as a survivor, you can point or make a 'come hear' motion but thats only helpful if they are looking at you

as a killer i always have fun unless all the survivors are running flashlight
they banned me due to "Toxicity And Griefing" i like the same its fun and all but devs banned me for no real reason soo there for gay game
I've laughed more playing this rather than feel terrified

With my gamer days mostly behind me, it's been a long time since I got obsessed with a game. Dead by Daylight managed to do it. This game is so much fun, and it never ends. 

I'm ... hooked.

Un poco repetitivo pero bastante entretenido y mas si jugas con amigos risas aseguradas

There's a lot to like *and* dislike in Dead by Daylight, especially dislike according to many, very vocal players. And yet, being the only truly successful exponent of the genre it "keeps getting away with it," as some would put it. 

This "review" is not going to cover the reasons why as one can find enough documentation online, making my little write-up essentially useless and totally-not-an-excuse to post a review for the Steam Awards event. Whoops!

But, briefly, DbD is as fun and rewarding as it can be miserable and frustrating. Be patient, don't take it too seriously, and bring some friends (imaginary ones if you're playing the role of killer).

Also, Resident Evil and Silent Hill characters in the same game would have been a huge deal, around 20 years ago. But it still is in my heart, dammit.
